notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): ANGLICE

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Drihten for þinre þære miclan mildheortnesse 7 for ealra þinra haligra lufan 7 gearnunga. gemiltsa | me synfullum sƿa sƿa þin mæra ƿilla sy | (p. 602) 7 min mod to þinum ƿillan gestranga 7 gestaðela

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: Drihten heofona heah cyning gestranga hi to ðinum | ƿillan. 7 gemildsa eallum þam ðe fulluhtes bæð | underfengon for ðinum naman. Amen

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Ker 1957, item 186, art. 9 (d) and item 249, art. c.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: ƿe gebiddað þe drihten 7 ðe gebletsiað forþi þurh ðine | rode þu alysdest ealne middangeard.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: drihten helend crist ic geeadmede þe on | rode astigendne 7 ðyrnenne kynehelm | on haefde berendne ic bidde ðe þæt seo sylfe | rod me alyse fram ðam sleandan engle

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Renderings usually sentence by sentence, of Latin forms of prayer to the Cross, under the heading 'Item alię orationes latine et anglice'. See Ker 1957 for textual variation.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: GYF ÐE ÐYNCE þæt ðine fynd þƿyrlice ymbe þe ðry | dian ðonne gang þu on gelimplicere stoƿe 7 þe ða | halgan rode to gescyldnesse gesciig 7 asete þe aðenedum | earmum and cweð þus ærest

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: y ƿyrc | sƿyþe gelome cristes rode tacen on ðinum heafde. 7 cƿeð þis gelome | Ecce crucem domini. 7 cƿeð ðis þonne. Hoc signaculo sancte crucis

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The charm is added in an originally blank space at the end of quire 40. Pp. 619, 620 are blank.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (beginning imperfect) kiningum 7 ricum mannum bið mycel syb þy geare

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: On xxx nihte | aldne monan efter tƿegra daga fyrste þæt sƿe | fen agæð butan frecednesse

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: On an weardne gear gif hit þunreð.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Gif mon bið acennen on sunnandæg

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Onre [sic] I nihte ealdne monan.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Se ðe onre [sic] nihte monan weorðeð untrum.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: ariseð. Ðis is eallum genæne iungum ˥ealdum. Finit.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: [Ð]ry dagas synd on XII monðum mid III nihtum.

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: The Latin note in Ker 1957, item 70, p. 49.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Ðry dagas synd on XII monðum þa synd swiðe unhalwende.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Þonne se mone, bið anre nihte swa hwæt swa þu gesihst.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Preceded on pp. 718-20 by a Latin version.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (p. 721) þreo daƿes beoþ on tƿeolf moneþ, þ[...] | beoþ sƿuþe unhaleƿende monne oþer | nutene. blod on to forletene. oþer [drnr] to | drinkene. most of þ[...] (probably þæt) was cut off; [drnr] should probably be 'drenc'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Date
notes.body: s. xiiiin

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Tremulous Hand

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Four lines added in a blank space, a copy with linguistic alterations of the first four lines of item 10 above.

objectDesc.support: Parchment. Heavy, small and compact book, weighing perhaps 2 kg.
objectDesc.extent:
225 mm x 135 mm (dimensions of all - size of leaves).
c. 173 mm x 94s mm (dimensions of all - size of written space).

binding: Twentieth-century binding. Rust marks from an older binding show on pp. 711-24.

history.origin: The three hymns for St. Oswald, the high positions of Saints Oswald and Egwin among saints invoked in a prayer on p. 598 and the script of pp. 581-91 (similar to Hatton 113 and Hatton 114) and of pp. 597-612 indicate that it was written at Worcester.
history.provenance: A note at the foot of p. 1, s. xiii, reads 'Liber sancte marie Wygornensis ecclesie per sanctum Oswaldum', but a note by Joscelyn beside the inscription points out that this cannot have been St. Oswald's book, and that it belonged to the age of Bishop Wulfstan II (1062-95) (Ker 1957, p. 115).
history.acquisition: Bequeathed by Archbishop Parker to Corpus Christi College in 1757.

admin: Manuscript described by Elaine Treharne with the assistance of Natalie Jones, Hollie Morgan and Sanne van der Schee (2010; 2013). Thanks are due to Anthony Esposito for his helpful feedback after the description was first published in 2010.
